1.name: The Wizard of Oz
1.description: Dorothy Gale is swept away from a farm in Kansas to a magical land of Oz in a tornado and embarks on a quest with her new friends to see the Wizard who can help her return home to Kansas and help her friends as well.

2.name: Gone with the Wind
2.description: A manipulative woman and a roguish man conduct a turbulent romance during the American Civil War and Reconstruction periods.

3.name: Stagecoach
3.description: A group of people traveling on a stagecoach find their journey complicated by the threat of Geronimo and learn something about each other in the process.

4.name: Ninotchka
4.description: A stern Russian woman sent to Paris on official business finds herself attracted to a man who represents everything she is supposed to detest.

5.name: Mr. Smith Goes to Washington
5.description: A naive man is appointed to fill a vacancy in the United States Senate. His plans promptly collide with political corruption, but he doesn't back down.

6.name: The Hunchback of Notre Dame
6.description: In 15th century France, a gypsy girl is framed for murder by the infatuated Chief Justice, and only the deformed bellringer of Notre Dame Cathedral can save her.

7.name: Wuthering Heights
7.description: A servant in the house of Wuthering Heights tells a traveller the unfortunate tale of lovers Cathy and Heathcliff.

8.name: Dodge City
8.description: A Texas cattle agent witnesses first hand, the brutal lawlessness of Dodge City and takes the job of sheriff to clean the town up.

9.name: The Rules of the Game
9.description: A bourgeois life in France at the onset of World War II, as the rich and their poor servants meet up at a French chateau.

10.name: The Women
10.description: A study of the lives and romantic entanglements of various interconnected women.

11.name: Gunga Din
11.description: In 19th century India, three British soldiers and a native waterbearer must stop a secret mass revival of the murderous Thuggee cult before it can rampage across the land.

12.name: Dark Victory
12.description: A young socialite is diagnosed with an inoperable brain tumor, and must decide whether or not she'll meet her final days with dignity.

13.name: The Little Princess
13.description: A little girl is left by her father in an exclusive seminary for girls, due to her father having to go to South Africa to fight in the Second Boer War.

14.name: Destry Rides Again
14.description: When a tough western town needs taming, the mild-mannered son of a hard-nosed sheriff gets the job.

15.name: Only Angels Have Wings
15.description: At a remote South American trading port, the manager of an air freight company is forced to risk his pilots' lives in order to win an important contract.

16.name: Nancy Drew and the Hidden Staircase
16.description: Nancy helps two aging spinsters fulfill the byzantine provisions of their father's will, but the murder of their chauffeur complicates matters.

17.name: Jamaica Inn
17.description: In Cornwall in 1819, a young woman discovers that she's living near a gang of criminals who arrange shipwrecks for profit.

18.name: The Hound of the Baskervilles
18.description: Sherlock Holmes and Dr Watson investigate the legend of a supernatural hound, a beast that may be stalking a young heir on the fog-shrouded moorland that makes up his estate.

19.name: Zenobia
19.description: A modest country doctor in the antebellum South has to contend with his daughter's upcoming marriage and an affectionate medicine show elephant.

20.name: Of Mice and Men
20.description: Two itinerant migrant workers, one mentally disabled and the other his carer, take jobs as ranch hands during the Great Depression to fulfill their shared dream of owning their own ranch.

21.name: The Flying Deuces
21.description: Ollie has fallen in love with the innkeeper's daughter in Paris. The only problem - she's very much in love with her husband. To forget her he joins the Foreign Legion with Stan. Bad idea.

22.name: The Roaring Twenties
22.description: Three men attempt to make a living in Prohibitionist America after returning home from fighting together in World War I.

23.name: Son of Frankenstein
23.description: One of the sons of Frankenstein finds his father's monster in a coma and revives him, only to find out he is controlled by Ygor who is bent on revenge.

24.name: The Old Maid
24.description: The arrival of an ex-lover on a young woman's wedding day sets in motion a chain of events which will alter her and her cousin's lives forever.

25.name: Beau Geste
25.description: Three adopted English brothers join the French Foreign Legion in North Africa, after one of them steals their adoptive family's famous heirloom sapphire.

26.name: Love Affair
26.description: A French playboy and an American former nightclub singer fall in love aboard a ship. They arrange to reunite six months later, after he has had a chance to earn a decent living.

27.name: The Four Feathers
27.description: A timid British Army officer has quit and burns his last day summons to a war in Egypt. Calling him a coward, his girl friend and 3 officer friends give him a white feather. In redemption, he shadows his friends in war to save their lives.

28.name: Bachelor Mother
28.description: An unemployed woman discovers an abandoned baby on the steps of an orphanage, and accepts an offer to take responsibility for the child in return for a job.

29.name: Susannah of the Mounties
29.description: Shirley is the orphaned survivor of an Indian attack in the Canadian West. A Mountie and his girlfriend take her in. Everybody suffers further Indian attacks and the Mountie is saved from ...                See full summary »

30.name: Goodbye, Mr. Chips
30.description: An aged teacher and former headmaster of a boarding school recalls his career and his personal life over the decades.

31.name: A Chump at Oxford
31.description: As a reward for capturing a bank robber, Stan and Ollie get scholarship to Oxford, but are met with resentment by other students.

32.name: Union Pacific
32.description: In 1862, Central Pacific and Union Pacific Railroads compete westward across the wilderness toward California.

33.name: Jesse James
33.description: After railroad agents forcibly evict the James family from their family farm, Jesse and Frank turn to banditry for revenge.

34.name: Hitler - Beast of Berlin
34.description: Hans Memling, a young intellectual, patriotic German, is secretly opposed to the Nazi regime. With the aid of Gustav Schultz, Father Pommer, Anna Wahl and others, he is gleaning accurate ...                See full summary »

35.name: Another Thin Man
35.description: An explosives manufacturer suspects a young man is out to kill him. He calls in new parents Nick and Nora to sort things out.

36.name: The Lion Has Wings
36.description: Alexander Korda's bit for the British war effort shows the world both at peace and on the verge of Nazi domination. Spliced together to form a documentary-style movie of both newsreel and ...                See full summary »

37.name: Tarzan Finds a Son!
37.description: Tarzan finds a boy from a crashed plane and raises him with Jane in the jungle. A search party comes looking for the plane.

38.name: In Name Only
38.description: After a wealthy man finds out his wife is a gold digger, he meets and falls for a widowed mother, and complications ensue.

39.name: Made for Each Other
39.description: While on a business trip, an ambitious young lawyer meets and immediately falls in love with a stranger. They wed the following day, and tragedy soon strikes.

40.name: Young Mr. Lincoln
40.description: A fictionalized account of the early life of the American president as a young lawyer facing his greatest court case.

41.name: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes
41.description: The master sleuth hunts his archenemy, Professor Moriarty, who is planning the crime of the century.

42.name: Le Jour Se Leve
42.description: After committing a murder, a man locks himself in his apartment and recollects the events that led him to the killing.

43.name: Buck Rogers
43.description: A 20th Century pilot named Buck Rogers and his young friend Buddy Wade awake from 500 years in suspended animation to find that the world has been taken over by the outlaw army of Killer Kane.

44.name: Nancy Drew... Reporter
44.description: Nancy Drew, reporter for the school newspaper, clears a girl of murder charges.

45.name: It's a Wonderful World
45.description: When a tycoon is accused of murder, the private eye tracking him finds himself roped in as an accessory and attempts to evade police, kidnapping a poetess along the way.

46.name: Nancy Drew... Trouble Shooter
46.description: When a close friend of the Drew family is accused of murder in a rural community, Nancy, aided by boyfriend Ted, helps her lawyer father expose the real killers.

47.name: The Man in the Iron Mask
47.description: Despotic King Louis XIV discovers he has a twin brother who has grown up under the tutelage of his foster father, the patriotic musketeer D'Artagnan.

48.name: Pacific Liner
48.description: The S. S. Arcturus sails from Shanghai to San Francisco, and Dr. Jim Craig takes the post of ship's physician in order to be near Ann Grayson, the ship's nurse. Chief Engineer 'Crusher" ...                See full summary »

49.name: Midnight
49.description: A chorus girl stranded in Paris is set up by a millionaire to break up his wife's affair with another man, while being romantically pursued by a cab driver.

50.name: Babes in Arms
50.description: A group of vaudevillians struggling to compete with talkies hits the road hoping for a comeback. Frustrated to be left behind, all of their kids put on a show themselves to raise money for the families and to prove they've got talent, too.
